patterns: Do you know about Credit Score
responses: Credit Score is a 3-digit number (between 300 & 900) calculated by a Credit Bureau using the credit history of an individual.The four RBI-authorized Credit Bureaus in India are - CRIF Highmark, Transunion (CIBIL), Equifax & Experian.
Maintaining a higher credit score means that your loan application is more likely to be accepted. It also means that you could be eligible for better interest rates and better deals on loans.

patterns: things that affects my credit score
What are the factors that affect Credit Score?
responses: Your credit score gets affected by the below-mentioned factors :- a) Your payment history - Payment history defines how consistently you have made your payments on time. This is the most important contributor to your credit score. b) Credit utilization ratio - Your credit utilization is the second most important contributor to your credit score. Using more than 30% of your available credit is a negative to the creditors. c) Tenure of credit history - Tenure of credit history simply means for how long you have held the credit accounts. Generally, the older your credit account, the higher your credit score. d.New credit account - The number of credit accounts you have recently opened, as well as the number of hard inquiries lenders make when you apply for credit affects your credit score. Too many accounts or inquiries reflects an increase in risk which may hurt your credit score. e)Credit mix - Your score can increase if you responsibly use different types of credit, such as installment and revolving debt. Even so, it's not necessary to have many different types of credit in order to have a good score.
A credit report is a statement that has information about your credit activity and current credit situation such as loan paying history and the status of your credit accounts.

intents.tag: difference in credit score and credit report?
patterns: What is the difference between credit score and credit report?
Difference between credit score and credit report
responses: Credit score is basically a 3-digit number that summarizes your credit history. However, credit score is a part of credit report, which comprises of your complete credit history of credit cards and all kind of loans

patterns: How often is my credit score updated?
When will my credit score update?
How much time does it take for credit score to update
responses: You can fetch your credit score from SahiBnk only once a month. After one month user can click on Refresh button and the credit score will get updated.
CRIF High Mark is one of the four RBI licensed Credit Information Companies in India, with the other three being CIBIL, Experian, and Equifax

patterns: What range of CRIF credit score is considered good for getting loan?
Tell me about CRIF credit score range
responses: Every financial institution uses their own criteria and benchmark to assess loan applicants' Credit report and Score. However, below are the ranges of CRIF Credit Score with their category: 1) Score from 750 to 900 is considered Excellent 2) Score from 650 to 749 is considered High 3) Score from 550 to 649 is considered Medium 4) Score from 300 to 549 is considered Low
